intro: Licania cardiophylla, commonly known as the heart-leaf licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes resembling a heart shape. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Licania cardiophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
